javadoc: ConflictUtility provides some constants and static methods used by the Listing Merge portion of the multi-user merge. For now, the VariousChoicesPanel and VerticalChoicesPanel use HTML in JLabels to display color etc. This is because they also show radiobuttons and checkboxes.

methods.javadoc: Puts HTML and BODY tags around the string.
methods.name: wrapAsHTML
methods.comment: Puts HTML and BODY tags around the string.

methods.name: colorString
methods.comment:
This creates color text by wrapping a text string with an HTML font tag 
 that has a color attribute.

methods.name: colorString
methods.comment:
This creates a colored number by converting the number to a string and 
 wrapping it with an HTML font tag that has a color attribute.

methods.name: spaces
methods.comment:
Creates a string for the number of spaces indicated that can be used in HTML.
 This string can be used to preserve spacing.

return.comment: the string representing that many spaces in HTML.

methods.name: addCount
methods.comment: Adds a color number to the indicated string  buffer.

methods.name: addAddress
methods.comment: Adds a color program address to the indicated string buffer.

methods.name: getConflictCount
methods.comment:
Creates a standard conflict count message. This indicates which conflict
 you are resolving of some total number of conflicts.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getConflictCount
methods.comment:
Creates a standard conflict count message for an address. This indicates which conflict
 you are resolving of some total number of conflicts at a given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for the indicated conflicts.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getConflictCount
methods.comment:
Creates a standard conflict count message for an address range. This indicates which conflict
 you are resolving of some total number of conflicts for a given address range.

params.name: range
params.comment: the address range for the indicated conflicts.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getAddressConflictCount
methods.comment:
Creates a standard address set conflict count message. This indicates 
 which address or address range with conflicts you are resolving of some 
 total number of addresses or address ranges with conflicts.

params.name: totalAddresses
params.comment: the total number of conflicting addresses.

params.name: isRange
params.comment: true if the current conflict is for an address range.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getTruncatedHTMLString
methods.comment:
Surrounds the originalString with HTML tags. It truncates the string at
 truncLength number of characters and adds "..." if it is longer than truncLength.
 It also replaces newline characters with HTML break tags.
 
 Warning: The originalString should not contain special HTML tags. If it does,
 they may get truncated in the middle of a tag.

return.comment: the truncated message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: replaceNewLines
methods.comment: Replaces new lines in the given string with HTML break tags.

params.name: text
params.comment: the original string containing new lines.

return.comment: the new string containing break tags.

methods.name: getAddressString
methods.comment: Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the address in color.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getAddressString
methods.comment: Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the address in color.

params.name: showAddressSpace
params.comment: true indicates the address string should show the address space.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getNumberString
methods.comment: Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the integer number in color.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getEmphasizeString
methods.comment: Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the text in color for emphasis.

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getOffsetString
methods.comment:
Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the offset value in 
 color as a hexadecimal value.

params.name: offset
params.comment: the offset to be displayed in hexadecimal

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

methods.name: getHashString
methods.comment:
Creates a string containing HTML tags to represent the hash value in 
 color as an unsigned hexadecimal value.

params.name: hash
params.comment: the hash to be displayed in hexadecimal

return.comment: the message string containing HTML tags.

name: ConflictUtility
comment:
ConflictUtility provides some constants and static methods 
 used by the Listing Merge portion of the multi-user merge.
 For now, the VariousChoicesPanel and VerticalChoicesPanel use HTML in
 JLabels to display color etc. This is because they also show radiobuttons
 and checkboxes.

fields.javadoc: Color to use for displaying addresses.
fields.name: ADDRESS_COLOR
fields.comment: Color to use for displaying addresses.

fields.javadoc: Color to use for displaying numeric values.
fields.name: NUMBER_COLOR
fields.comment: Color to use for displaying numeric values.

fields.javadoc: Color to use for displaying emphasized text. (for example, this is used when displaying symbols.)
fields.name: EMPHASIZE_COLOR
fields.comment: Color to use for displaying emphasized text. (for example, this is used when displaying symbols.)

fields.javadoc: Color to use for displaying offsets.
fields.name: OFFSET_COLOR
fields.comment: Color to use for displaying offsets.

fields.javadoc: String to display when a version doesn't have a value for an element of the program.
fields.name: NO_VALUE
fields.comment: String to display when a version doesn't have a value for an element of the program.
